Posts.Content: angels21 wrote: I wonder if anyone would kindly share their experience of WBRT.my mother had her first treatment today.1 of 5 sessions. This is to treat brain mets which were discovered a week ago.as there are multiple areas.has there been positive outcomes? How did the treatment make u feel when it was over?im very worried. I hope someone will share their story? Many thanks.. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: whole brain radiation experience angels21 fifthyear

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2015 02:56PM angels21 wrote: Hi..just got letter through from mums specialist saying that the cancer has spread to the liver as well as wide spread bone metastasis. The orginal findings in the breast as well as lungs have also increased..im extremely scared now.the consultant had orginallyput mum on letrozole since last august but it stopped working a couple of months ago.we are wondering if she should have put her on chemo first.the progression seems rapid. Feel helpless..we will push for chemo as quick as possible. Its strange mum has no physical symptoms apart from tiredness..which is more than before.her blood test results are ok..is this something that can be tackled?? Has anyone had the same sort of progression and had control with chemo??..I feel numb right now and alone..
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2015 01:12PM angels21 wrote: Hi Oceandust Thank you for your kind response.it is always helpful to connect to someone in the same situation..I really admire the strength of each and everyone going through this ordeal.i hope there is light after the tunnel for all of us. .it must be so hard for you as youve lost alot of family members..I went through the same emotions as you..I wondered why god was giving us such a hard time.but we are all tested I guess..im not sure what lies ahead..as I work full time iv not had a chance to meet with mum's new oncologist. I am going to do that shortly.as of now the doctor would like to proceed with chemo as the cancer is spreading. The other option is tamoxifen but by the time that enters the system the cancer could progress further.mum is going to have her appointment this week..I feel tensed. I just feel we should control this deadly disease Asap.i know chemo is strong stuff..im wondering how her body will cope.mum is quite active and in good health. Only thing is she gets bouts of tiredness..does your mother get this too??with all this going on she still doesn't have many symptoms. Which proves how clever this disease works.i agree with u..we have to stay strong for our mums, they are precious.if they see us down it wont help.This forum is helping me immensely. Iv spent nights twisting and turning..cant imagine not hearing mums voice, her laugh. .bit too much at times..will try and stay postive..I wish u and ur mother all the best.thank you for being there xx
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2015 01:24PM angels21 wrote: Hi Zillsnot4me  Very kind of you to forward the link for the videos.i will share this with mum.she has a genuine interest in meditation.im sure this will help her.she has an interest in yoga and spends an hour doing deep breathing in the morning.im trying to find out how to improve the nutrition side of things. Is there anything you recommend mum should be taking to prepare her for chemo. Shes eating mostly healthy stuff, broccoli, kale, vegs, fruit..iv asked her to try green tea, heard that fights cancer..you are certainly right im the only child..if I had siblings it wouldve been easier for me to cope..im fortunate to be in touch with lovely ladies as yourself.i hope ur doing well..You asked where I was from..im based in the UK. .
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: angels21 wrote: Hi..im new to this forum. I just hope I can reach out to you and get some positive advice.today my mum went to the hospital for her scan results. The scan shows that her breast cancer has spread to the liver. Mum was diagnosed a year ago and the disease presented itself in the breast as well as lung nodules. This discovery has left me devastated as we thought the medication she was on for the last year:letrozole was controlling things.it has stopped working. We have been advised today to start chemo within 2 weeks:chlorphosphomide 6 cycles. Has anyone gone through a similar situation? Is it common for drugs to stop working? Has anyone been able to control symptoms for a long time? Im so scared.im the only child of my parents.dont want to lose mum.cant face this.not sure what to expect from chemo?are there any stories of hope? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2015 11:07AM angels21 wrote: Hi Zillsnotme..many thanks for kind response.i read ur message lots of times and feel better.i think your right..im feeling extremely anxious.i try not to show it but deep down feel frightened.Mum called up the clinic today..they will go through the process of blood tests.there is also a bone strengthening injection that will be given..then there will be a date scheduled for chemo.im glad that your treatment has kept u stable.thank u for the encouragement too.they are planning to put mum on taxoxfin as well once the chemo stops.i will try an stay strong.im the only child so its hard sometimes..its just when you read the diagnosis on paper it shocks u..This is one journey we have to fight..so kind of you to offer this valuable advice. Hope u are keeping well xx
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2015 05:28AM angels21 wrote: Aww thanks again for ur wonderful message..we went for the first chemo yesterday. .it was kind of surreal.the nurses put a line implant into mums vein in her arm.after a while they began pumping in the drugs..its a EC75 cycle not FEC..you were spot on with the reactions. .I think mum was incredibly anxious and that's what brought on the excessive tiredness. .her bp was very high..as soon as the treatment was over we came home and she felt a lot better, appetite came back too..it is the fear of the unknown. She slept very well during the night.i was restless as I was looking out for any side effects.so far no vomiting or nausea. We are taking the drugs and steroids as directed.Â  The experience took it out of me initially but il try and build up strength to keep going and stay brave..not sure which what head gear will be suitable..il look on the internet..i agree wigs are abit hard to cope with in summer.i like the bandanas.they look cool.i said to mum make sure u wear ur lovely burgundy lipstick. .her trademark. How are your kids doing?? How did they cope with the news?? Being a parent is a huge responsibility..im sure they are ur recovery by themselves. .children are full of hope and innocence. . Thank u for being there. .dont feel so alone..appreciate ur encouragement...xxx
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2015 03:41PM angels21 wrote: Dear Charlotte.. Many thanks for your lovely message.im sorry for the delay in my reply.i cant express how grateful I am for the advice given. I hope all is well with you.just getting an insight into your experiences is amazing . Charlotte you sound like a real fighter.i must confess I have been devastated by mums progression. I was at work when I heard the news..it was like hearing the diagnosis for the first time..just burst into tears. I can totally relate to the closeness you share with ur daughter..im the same with mum. so used to hearing her voice on the end of the phone.she is my best friend and back bone.prior to this discovery of breast cancer my father had a severe phycotic attack. He stopped eating and drinking. We had 3 years of high stress, in and out of hospitals. Mum has always put herself last and now this has happened.the specialists have not discussed the chemo process in great detail yet.i know our lives are going to change very soon.mum is keeping herself going but I know she is scared.its natural I guess.she is going to lose her hair.i hear this happens quite quick.i will get her some colourful scarves. will certainly get mum a ipad/ tablet. Like you suggested it will be good for her to join a forum like this.the stories iv read are simply inspirational..is there any special diet you follow?? Or vitamins you take?? Mum does yoga and it makes her feel better.Its so nice to hear that you will be a grand mother soon.congratulations.exciting time for your family.you are right a mother/ daughter relationship is so special.treasure those moments.lesson to learn is enjoy every minute.thank you for reassuring me.means the world. Will keep you updated on developments. Love and best wishes Angeline.
Posts.Title: scared about my mum angels21 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2015 11:43AM angels21 wrote: Hi there.. Sorry for the delay in my reply..Thank you for your kind advice..I hope u are having a lovely holiday..yes I wish we couldve met too..it helps to share experiences.. Mum will be starting chemo tommorow..i feel tonight is going to a tough one sleeping..im getting anxious just not showing it..the doctors will give her the fec 75.im not sure of what to expect. This treatment will be spread out for 4 months..6 cycles..Im praying her body can withstand the chemo.mum is feeling increasingly tired..Iv never seen her like this..does this mean the cancer is progressing even more.. Thank u for the diet related info..she us eating less than before.maybe axiety or the liver.Her appetite isnt best..shes a vegetarian so we will have to talk to her nurse. I will be at the hospital just to make sure she's ok..this is alot to take in..I feel scared out of my head..will pray to god to give everyone with this condition strength. . I will keep in touch. .I hope ur feeling well..xxx
